comments: My favorite art professor at scsu. He taught me a lot of new techniques and was always nearby if we had questions. Unlike other art forms, though metal working requires a lot of math and has certain elements that can\'t be subjective. If you go into the class with that in mind you\'ll enjoy it much more. Also get ready to sand for hours.

has a negative attitude towards his students, rarely gives complements, does not help much and if he does he acts like you are stupid for asking a question... this is a BEGINNER art class and he treats it like you are suppose to be a pro... I would never take him again

Very skilled in his knowledge, but insetting to everyone else. He RARELY offers a compliment, & is often demeaning to students (even though its beginners class). His condescending remarks about how easy something should be & how you\'re doing it wrong reinforce how insecure he must be, considering it\'s an ART class and it\'s supposed to be subjective

Very unclear about helping you coordinate what you want to do with how much time you have to do it. He says you can certainly do the project, but fails to mention how "tricky"the idea you\'re trying to manifest really is. He\'s super fun, but if you\'re foreign to metalworking, be prepared to spend a ton of time in lab hours.

Very little guidance, demos or helpful suggestions. You pretty much worked on your own. The assignments were very ambiguous and/or confusing. For any troubleshooting - go in during lab hours. The lab tech is very knowledgable & helpful.

its a lot of work.... I also find art assignments odd. its art, im no good at being restricted with the creative process. i would not retake him as a prof but it also has been some years for both of us so things could be different. Also didnt enjoy working with brass and copper, ect.
Great guy, hard grader, more into metal smithing than jewlery, but making something of my own was the real reward!
